title: Atascocita leaves little for debate, beats Pearland to advance to regional semifinals - Houston Chronicle
text:

Atascocita quarterback Daveon Boyd lunges toward the end zone in the Eagles' 35-14 win over Pearland Saturday at NRG Stadium. Photo: Kirk Sides Atascocita leaves little for debate, beats Pearland to advance to regional semifinals 1 / 11 Back to Gallery 
It doesn't matter to Atascocita coach Craig Stump if quarterback Daveon Boyd is handing off, passing, lateraling or running the ball. 
Just as long as the final result is achieved. 
Boyd left little for Stump to debate Saturday at NRG Stadium as the versatile senior accounted for 374 total yards and four touchdowns in Atascocita's 35-14 win over Pearland in a Class 6A Division I area football matchup. 
The win sends the Eagles (10-1) into the regional semifinals against Lamar (11-1) at 4 p.m. Friday at NRG Stadium. 
Atascocita led just 14-7 at halftime, but it pulled away with big plays on offense and defense. 
"Any time you give up seven points in a half, you should be able to give yourself a good chance to win," Stump said. "We scored first in the second half, and then it got a little frustrating when we fumbled down there on the 1. 
"I didn't think it was a fumble, but who knows? You have to give the ball to the official. There are no replays in high school. But we continued to move the ball and the defense made good stops." 
Responded early, often 
Boyd completed 21 of 33 passes for 303 yards and two touchdown passes while rushing for 71 yards and scoring on runs of two and five yards. 
He threw a 30-yard scoring pass to Lujuan Winningham at 3:24 of the third quarter as Atascocita opened a 21-7 cushion. When Pearland cut the gap to 21-14, Boyd had to go to work again. 
He responded admirably, guiding Atasocita on two consecutive scoring drives. 
That 28-14 lead swelled to 35-14 just 1:46 later following an interception by Joshua Escobedo . 
Atasocita needed to travel just 17 yards and did so in four plays, capped by Boyd's 5-yard scoring run with 7:12 left. 
That TD provided more than enough cushion for the Eagles. 
"Them making crucial third-down plays and us not making them was the difference," Pearland coach Tony Heath said. "Our defense finally wore out. Our offense just didn't give the defense the opportunity to rest â€¦ and give them some life. 
"We've played with a short stick most of the year, and we've just patched it up every week. We gave a great effort. Atascocita just has a lot of weapons. 
"This is the class they've been waiting for. They have talent at quarterback, in the slots, at running back and in both lines. They're a good football team." 
Spreading the ball 
Atascocita's fumble at the Oilers' 1-yard line came on its first possession in the second half, but it didn't prove fatal in the long run. 
The Eagles' defense was up to the task, while Boyd kept drives alive by connecting with Winningham (seven catches, 111 yards, two scores) and Alerick Soularie (6-120-0). 
"The thing is, it was those two guys (Winningham and Soularie) this week, and it was another guy last week," Stump said. "You look at our stats and it's spread around. I call things based on defense, not who's in the game. They're all expected to make it happen." 
Atascocita led Pearland (8-4) 14-7 at halftime following a scoreless first quarter. 
Pearland (8-4) scored the game's first points on its initial possession of the second period, moving 74 yards in six plays to take a 7-0 advantage at the 10:10 mark. 
A 16-yard completion from Oiler quarterback Whitehead to wide receiver Christian Lake moved Pearland to its 44 yard line. 
Three plays later, Oiler running back Jaelin Benefield broke through the front wall of the Atascocita defense and found open space en route to a 44-yard scoring run. 
Two possessions later, the Eagles produced the equalizing score after Atasocita's Jaylon Allen pounced on a muffed punt at the Pearland 25 yard line. 
The Eagles needed five plays to reach the end zone, using a fourth-and-1 run of four yards by Demmerritte to reach the Pearland 12. 
From there, Daveon Boyd fired a scoring strike to Winningham on a slant route with 6:43 left in the half, and David Heaton 's PAT kick tied the game at 7. 
Atascocita grabbed the 7-point halftime cushion courtesy of an 8-play, 54-yard march which culminated with Boyd's 2-yard sweep of right end.The biggest installment in that march was a 32-yard third-down pass from Boyd to Demmerritte.
